results.title: Graham Baxter: park ranger
results.creator_credit: Rob Salvatore and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Only a fortunate few live and work in a place as beautiful as this. Wilson’s Promontory Park Ranger Graham Baxter explains why every day for him is a special day in this place ‘for the soul’.

results.title: Love at first sight
results.brief_description: An unhappy couple plan a special anniversary dinner but neither realises just how “special” the other has made it. A new husband discovers that he is just the latest in a long line of young men that his powerful older wife has seduced. A gigolo versus black widow battle of the sexes from the director of ‘Babe’ (1995). Cast features June Salter and Richard Moir. Original format 16mm/black and white.

results.title: Trades Hall, Carlton: the early years
results.brief_description: Interviewee Paddy Garritty, Union Promotions, provides a brief historical picture of the early beginnings of the Trades Hall building in Carlton, in inner Melbourne. He talks about the origins of the Eight-Hour Day, the Trade Union movement and the establishment of the Trades Hall Council (a central hall for the skilled trades movement set up by the Freemasons) and the visions of this Hall as a facilitator for education, health and the arts for the working class. Interviewer: Leesa Carriage.

results.title: Guru
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Pascal Guilloux and Safina Uberoi
results.brief_description: In the West, people fall in love and then get married. In India, people get married and then fall in love. But this is not India - this is Parramatta, in Sydney, Australia…A film celebrating cultural clashes amidst a wild and wonderful festival of colour. Original format 16 mm.

results.title: Universal Appliance Co.
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Michaeley O'Brien, Ruth Kleinhenz and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: 1. An inventor finally gets a chance to mass produce his latest creation at the Universal Appliance Company factory. The production line runs smoothly until advertising and romance become distractions. Another multi-award winning production for director and sound designer Andrew Lancaster.

results.title: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History
results.brief_description: Comprehensively portrayed by the archival footage in this film is a harrowing history of a government policy forcing Aboriginal Australians to assimilate to the white definitions of education and work, mission stations, removal of Aboriginal children, forced labour often in deplorable conditions and exploitation.
results.title_for_label: Close to Slavery: Black Work in White History

results.title: Never Done: Women, Work and History
results.brief_description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. Focuses on women in the workplace from the mid-1800s through to the 1970s including footage of the first women’s union (1882); industrialisation and factory work; the birth of the modern office worker (1890s); equal pay for equal work movement; WWI and WWII women in the workforce; trade-unionism and feminism.
results.description: ‘Never done: women, work and history’. results.title: Projected Memories: Work in old films
results.brief_description: ‘Projected memories: work in old films’. In 1947, a projectionist took a collection of instructional 16mm films about work to the bush. This short film includes excerpts from that collection covering early footage (1900s-1930s) of families on the land; factory workers; steel workers; coal miners; working women; the rise of trade-unions and the 8-hour day; peace campaign of 1938; the invention of the teleprinter; the arrival of the corner grocer shop and much more.

results.title: Culture, respect and law
results.brief_description: Collin Walker Snr, a Yorta Yorta elder, tells of mission life and living in Echuca. This story was produced in one of ACMI’s regional workshops conducted in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: A Postcard from Ovens
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Jack Keane and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: An edited excerpt from ‘Working Holiday’ (1957) produced by Jack Keane for the Victorian Department of Agriculture. Shows hop picking in Victoria where seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. The weekend breaks are spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Jack Keane and ACMI Content Development
